oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The potential of organic farming in drylands of India
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sharma, Arun K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm nutrient management
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Social aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic agriculture, a holistic system that focuses on improvement of soil health, use of local inputs, and relatively high-intensity use of local labor, is an admirable fit for drylands in many ways, and the drylands offer many benefits that would make it relatively easy to implement.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Sharma, Arun K. (2006) The potential of organic farming in drylands of India. http://ag.arizona.edu/OALS/ALN/aln58/sharma.html (58).
